io.atomix.resource

Annotation Type ResourceTypeInfo


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface ResourceTypeInfo
    Annotation for specifying resource state and serialization information.

    Resources must be annotated with this annotation to be managed by the Atomix cluster. This annotation provides information about the resource's state machine and serialization of resource commands. Atomix will use the annotation at runtime to create a ResourceType with which it can identify the resource type and create server-side replicated state machines and register serializable types relevant to the resource.

    Author:

      • Required Element Summary

        Required Elements 
        Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
        int id
        The 8-bit resource type ID.
        Class<? extends ResourceStateMachine> stateMachine
        The resource state machine class.
        Class<? extends SerializableTypeResolver> typeResolver
        The resource serializable type resolver.

    • Element Detail

      • id

        public abstract int id
        The 8-bit resource type ID.

        This identifier must be unique across all resource types and should be within the range -128 to 127. Core Atomix resource types are typically identified with negative numbers, so the range 1 through 127 is reserved for user-provided resource types.

      • stateMachine

        public abstract Class<? extends ResourceStateMachine> stateMachine
        The resource state machine class.

        This is the state machine class that Atomix will construct on each server in the cluster. The state machine is responsible for managing state on each server. Each resource instance has an associated state machine which will last throughout its lifetime.

      • typeResolver

        public abstract Class<? extends SerializableTypeResolver> typeResolver
        The resource serializable type resolver.

        Resource types should provided a SerializableTypeResolver to specify how to serialize commands and queries and any other types of objects required to operate the resource. Atomix will query the type resolver to ensure serializable types are registered on both clients and servers prior to usage of the resource.
